title: Student Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interview includes 5 candidates, all have the opportunity to share a fun activity with the candidates to measure their enthusiasm regarding the position, Ends with an activity given to you to show teamwork on how to solve recent student issues.
Interview Questions: Please share your 5 minute activity with us

title: Marketing Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Sunand was an excellent interviewer who made me feel comfortable as a co-op student. His ability to connect with me in the first few minutes really negated any nerves I had prior to the interview. Additionally, I would say he asked the right questions to place me in the correct environment where my skillset would be used best.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were faced with a conflict within a team and how did you handle the situation?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: two interviews the first includes around 4 interviewers ask you 16 questions about your strengths and experiences, which will include technical information For the second interview, you have to design and present a mini-teach lecture and treat interviewers as students
Interview Questions: tell about yourself strengths weakness how will you contribute to Sheridan

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Vidcruiter interview. It was unusual but pretty easy to complete. You just have to get used to talking to the a camera only and not a real person. I did not advance to the next stage.
Interview Questions: Explain how your experience would make you a good fit for this role.

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It went smoothly, they asked about my background and why I wanted to become a tutor. Also asked me what position/course I was comfortable with tutoring. Emailed me shortly after to confirm that I got in
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a tutor?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews including a take home assignment after the first interview. The assignment was presented 2-days later to the hiring manager and department director. After the second interview a third interview involved senior leaders from other departments and the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How does your previous experience make you a perfect candidate for this role?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: One very reasonable conversation about experience and style and skill level with international students. Discussing skill and set up for in person and remote. I would say it was very simple an interview. The paperwork they need is more than some colleges - formal referal from colleagues etc. have your paperwork in order.
Interview Questions: How do you handle engagement in a remote classroom.

title: Coop Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: The job was described, it was with the hiring manager, HR and a Coop student.  Questions were asked that included why should we hire you, challenge with a team, how do you manage stress, student focus etc.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: great, was an overall good experience, friendly and clear about expectations, salary not the best but overall good experience, the overall environment was below average but generally good feeling about the work location
Interview Questions: What are your best strengths?

title: Laptop and Classroom Support Technician - COOP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Brampton, ON) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: number of technical questions asked, such as what is TCP/IP, what is a honeypot? they did identify at the end of the interview that customer support is the more important trait as technical knowledge can be taught
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with a complex computer problem

title: Math Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: They asked me several questions about my past work and volunteer experience, some situational questions, and then asked me to teach a fraction question to them on the board to assess teaching skills. It was a casual and positive interview.
Interview Questions: What is something that makes you laugh?

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview consisting of an online teaching session and presentation. Interview (including presentation) was very short and capped at 45 minutes. I ended up withdrawing my application so did not complete complete the interview process.
Interview Questions: Asked about my previous experience. Asked how I felt about collaborating with other professors.

title: Painting Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer did not even show up. The meeting was supposed to be on Zoom, and they did not give me a link to a Zoom meeting, nor did they reply to my emails or calls in an attempt to reschedule the meeting.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Brampton, ON) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the position via Sherdian Works and had a panel interview via Microsoft Teams. They sent me a list of questions that would be covered 30 minutes before the interview, which went well. I received an offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time where you had to work within a group and how did it go?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview
Asked to describe experience as related to position
Friendly interviewers that were open to questions
Interviewers knew their subject areas and were open to discussing current and future goals
Interview took an hour but could have easily run longer as conversation flowed easily. 
Ultimately position salary was lower than comparables for the work that was required, I brought that up to the panel, the response was obviously mixed. I did not get the position
Interview Questions: Describe how your experience is a fit for this role

title: Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Video Record where about 5 question are given and you have 2 chances. The question is given one by one with one minute preparation. The question are both behavioral and technical
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult persons

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Interview expectations and duration were well explained. Participants were friendly and neutral. Comfortable and casual zoom. Questions were very good and relevant to the position. They were open to my questions and interested in my experiences.
Interview Questions: They asked my approach to ensuring diversity and equality.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interview. One with hr, two with managers. They mostly hire within the union or school. Very little chance if you dont work there. Every position has a lot of applicants
Interview Questions: Education and experience

title: Tutoring Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Audio phone by Microsoft team. They have 2 people: 1 is HR, and another. Question: Introduce yourself, ask 2 questions about Accounting, 2 questions about behaviour. I waited 2 weeks to get this job. But this job is perfect. Sheridan College is good environment
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself, ask 2 questions about Accounting, 2 questions about behaviour

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Nice environment, 1 round with recruiter and other. They ask 3 questions, introduce yourself, how to deal with problems, what is hardest you face in the university. 2 questions for accounting industry
Interview Questions: What is the FIFO in tax?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Standard behavioral questions and only a few technical questions. It was a video call in Microsoft teams with two interviewers watching your interview. It was relatively short where asked standard behavioral questions and only a few technical questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and tell me how the error in this block of code.

title: Technical Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. A good conversation with the IT manager. It took about 30 minutes. But totally no pressure, the manager even provided some advice about hoe to improve my resume.
Interview Questions: Related technical questions and some background information.

title: Marheting Club Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Asked general questions about Marketing and said all was good but couldn't hire me because I wouldn't get along with the team. I was wearing a hijab so I'm presuming that was why I wouldn't/
Interview Questions: Are you going out today?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: in person, 30 minutes. Simple and basic questions focusing on research and interpersonal skills. Interviewer was the lead researcher, who was very kind. They listened intently during the interview, and provided sufficient time for you to review the questions being asked of you.
Interview Questions: Past experience with qualitative research methods?

title: IT Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process involved a 3 person group panel. Each interviewer in the group panel asked questions that involved either technical knowledge competency level or personality traits to verify if you are a good fit for the position.

The process took approximately 20 minutes and was overall a professional and positive experience.
Interview Questions:
What is a honeypot and what is it used for?
What is a domain controller?
What is DNS?

title: Academics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: A talent recruiter will contact you by phone and will setup a phone interview with the hiring manager. If they're ok with you, then you'll proceed to have a face-to-face interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: some questions relating to your line of work.

title: Information Technology Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: This was a co-op position for students. The interview consists of behavior questions and some simple networking questions. It also included scenarios about fixing the printer and wireless connection to a laptop.
Interview Questions: What is TCP/IP, DHCP, and DNS.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Use computer interview online from ms team and it average interview when you come there and two interviewer will be at the same Time. Also, you need to prepare some interview question before going to interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Very simple interview, nothing hard at all. Very normal questions and straightforward process. The hiring process was a bit long but everything turned out ok in the end. The work days was normal nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in research?

title: Student Recruitment Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview along with other applicants. It feels like a focused group discussion vs. an interview; very relaxed feel and the interviewers were very nice. They seemed genuinely concerned to get to know you vs. just screen and give the applicants a hard time.
Interview Questions: Why do you like to join Sheridan STAR?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The Professor interviewing me had a form that he filled out as we progressed through the interview. It was somewhat casual and there was a lot of discussion. 

At the end of the interview I asked him what the top qualities of his ideal candidate are and he said the ability to learn and passion for the subject.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength and what is your greatest weakness?

title: Talent Acquisition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions:
30 Minute phone interview, then 60 minute in-person interview a couple of weeks later. 
Interviewed by two professional staff and the two outgoing co-op students. There was also a test involved, which was fairly easy (writing a mock email).
Interview Questions: What interests you most?

title: Human Resources Co-Op Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quite hard considering that it was a Co-op position. It was pretty structured and had questions typed up on a piece of paper. The interview panel wasn't friendly at all. My overall interview experience was negative.
Interview Questions: What criteria do you use to screen candidates for a job?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Guelph, ON) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was one over Skype. It was conducted by a panel of 2 people who were both later my supervisors. It was a comfortable interview with a few jokes and 4 questions: 2 HR questions and 2 technical questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Chill, and friendly. The interviewer wanted a chit-chat conversation rather than a long conversation of what you can give them. The hiring and interview process was pretty easy and not daunting
Interview Questions: Do you like working in teams

title: Game Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a short 30 minute interview with my program coordinator. We talked, and I got contacted within a week about an offer. I was hired along with 3 others.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous projects. What is your preferred roles and responsibilities?

title: Program Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: There were four interviewers.  Some of the questions were behavioural but a lot of them were also situational.  As in "what would you do if....".  It definitely helps if you have knowledge of how post secondary instutions work.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this job?

title: Accounting &Finance Learning Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Overall it was really easy interview. It was a short 10-min interview on campus. They asked me to explain a math problem on the board (a really simple question though).
Interview Questions: Asked to explain a math problem on the board.

title: Awareness Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Brampton, ON) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: They ask about the how I fit into job duties for this job with respect to my skills. Moreover they also ask what would be my first step if I got hired?
Interview Questions: How would you enthusiast your team to do the job?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: very nice people, not intimidating at all. asking very standard questions since it's just a student position. we just sat down at the office, and they asked about my resume and what i'm taking at the college. it was very casual
Interview Questions: describe the last time you had a conflict

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process . Asked basicaly about the work i have done in industry. If you have employee refereal then you will get the call. They go through your resume in very much detail . and ask any  question from the resume. so make sure that you prepare resume well
Interview Questions: tell me about your teach experience

title: STAR - Student Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The job posting requested for a resume and a cover letter. After I had that written, and tailored to fit the position, I went to their office and I learned I would also need a reference letter from my Program Adviser.
I then scheduled the interview, with the adviser for the reference letter, where I asked for the reference letter. She was very helpful and gave me one after she had checked my grades and my profile inside their academic system. 
With all the documents in hand, I delivered to their office and a few days after I was invited to participate in a group interview. The interview had 4 interviewers and round 10 candidates. As promised by them on the interview I got the job offer through email by the next day.
Interview Questions: What made you choose Sheridan as a student?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process consists of two stages. Department Coordinator and then the Department Manager.
Then you have to provide some previous feedback and references. They will contact your references to validate your experience
Interview Questions:
1) Qualifications
2) Teaching experience 
3) Students Feedback

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada)
Interview Descriptions: Hot! They didn't have A/C on in the room. Poorly prepared HR staff asking questions straight from a manual.  A panel interview with people I later learned had no business being in the room.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying here?

title: Support Staff At the Gym Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The interview took a bout a week.

Everything happen in person, I talked to the staff at front desk if they know anything about hiring there then  I left my resume at the front desk so that the manager would take a look at it.
After one week i get called i get to talk to the manager and he asks me if I am available Thursdays
he needed someone at the desk Thursdays.
There were no interview questions.
Interview Questions: Are you free Thursdays

title: Student Recruitment and Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was held with my manager and part time HR student. They are great at proving students experiences that are relevant to their field of study. The HR student got to participate in an interview and I as a Marketing student go to grow professionally given many social media related tasks.

The interview went very well. I felt very confident after the interview.
Interview Questions: All very standard interview questions. Just them getting to know you, to see if you are the right fit.

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by HR to come in for an interview.  Process very structured with detailed behavioural questions and panel interview.  Included skills test.  People were very nice and supportive.  Salary range seemed low given their expectations of the role. First interview was two hours including hour for skills test and hour for panel questions.  Email notification that you were not selected for the position.
Interview Questions: What are some of the challenges Academic institutions are facing

title: English Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Waterloo, ON) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I thought it was a pretty standard interview process. They introduced themselves and asked me several questions pertaining to Sheridan college and the position. They also went over my past job experience and my resume. I dressed professionally, but the interview had an overall casual feel.
Interview Questions: What are qualities of a good tutor?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Brampton, ON) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview setting, asking basic & standard questions which were fairly easy. Very friendly, not intimidating. Interview continued to a group setting where we were then weeded out and then trained as an entire staff.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply for this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Mississauga, ON) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Make sure you know people in the management. Its not what you know, but whom you know. Of course you are expected to know your field really well.
Interview Questions: What was your most negative experience working in a team and how did you overcome it

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Oakville, ON) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very non-conventional and informal. Interviews were held as part of a hiring fair for the student union food staff positions. Participants were randomly split into group interviews where we were asked informal questions. One at a time individuals were chosen one at a time for 5-minute interviews with management and then returned to their group interviews until the end of the night. The whole process took a couple of hours.
Interview Questions: If you could have a super power what would it be?

title: Classroom and Front Desk Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Sheridan College (Canada) (Brampton, ON) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied for coop position through jobs sheridan. At the time ibhad applied i was a student there at sheridan. As mentioned before, i was a coop student looking for a job and got an interview call in 2 days time. Got the job offer the same day in the evening on the day of the interview
Interview Questions: How would you staisfy a customer
